triceratops.description: Triceratops, one of the most recognized and beloved dinosaurs out of all. It's name means 'Three-horned face', derived from the greek words 'trí', 'kéras' and 'ṓps' meaning 'three', 'horn' and 'face' respectively. Standing at over 3 meters tall and over 8 meters in length, the Triceratops could weigh up to 10 metric tons, so the same weight as 4-5 cars. On top of that, it's iconic horns could grow to be over a meter in length. It will eat almost any plant, with the exeption of ferns and palms.

brachiosaurus.description: Being over 13 meters when standing fully upright, Brachiosaurus is far and away the largest dinosaur found in Jurassic Park. The word 'Brachiosaurus' means 'arm lizard' in latin, referring to the fact that brachiosaurus has larger forelimbs rather than larger hindlimbs. Due to this, It's torso is angled upwards quite significantly. The second part of it's name, 'Altithorax', means 'deep chest', referring to the relatively large and deep chest the Brachiosaurus had compared to most other sauropods. Because Brachiosaurus weighed around 30 tonnes, it had to eat around 300 kilogram of plants like conifers and tree ferns. This is so much that it has to eat for around 15 hours every day just to sustain itself.

visitor_center.description: The Visitor Center is one of the most important builings in the entire park. It's interior is round, with every quarter having a use. In the center, there's skeletal statues of a Tyrannosaurus and a Alamosaurus for the exhibition 'When Dinosaurs ruled the Earth. It is used for all kinds of things: being the central hub for visitors, being the biggest dining service on the island, having the garage for the tour cars and employee cars as well as containing the park's control room in an area restricted to visitors.

safari_lodges.description: The Safari Lodge is a hotel for vistors who wish to stay overnight rather than visit the park for a single night. The hotel located at the west side of the park, with a beautiful view over a lush safari zone. Visitors can stay at the hotel for a maximum of three nights, and the hotel offers breakfast and dining accommodations.

tour_station.description: At the tour station, take a seat in one of our fifteen Ford Explorer XLT automated tour cars for a tour throughout the park. These touring cars a locked to a electric railgrid, and thus don't need any drivers to pilot the car. Take a close look at some of our largest and most dangerous carnivores, and pass through the territories of the friendly herbivores. Because the cars drive automatically, you enter and exit the touring car at the tour station.

river_cruise.description: Step aboard our exiting River Cruise, a river attraction going through the areas of the Pteranodon, Stegosaurus, Brachiosaurus, Parasaurolophus and Proceratosaurus. Get close with the herbivores, whilst being able to look at the Pteranodon and Proceratosaurus without any glass. You are required to leave your bags at the station, because we will not allow visitors to bring food etc. near the dinosaurs.

helicopter_platform.description: This is the helicopter platform of Jurassic Park. The helipad is only used for medical emergencies, VIP guests and John Hammond himself. In case you were wondering, the helicopters used by Jurassic Park are two Agusta A-109A helicopters.

toilet.description: There are multiple toilets located around the park, each being decorated in the Jurassic Park style.
